item.title: [PI]Click In A Certain Place[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

thats for digging and ending up in a different area. you would have to modify that code to look something like this:

if(player.inArea(COORDS OF AREA)): addItem(ITEMID, ITEMAMOUNT);

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Click In A Certain Place[PI]
item.dc:creator: @erde0 erde0
item.description:
@erde0 wrote:

I found spade.py somewhere in Tragedy it says this:

# Spade Functions # Author: Lmctruck30 #

from server.util import ScriptManager

Dig

def itemClick_952(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.startAnimation(830)
if(player.inArea(3553, 3301, 3561, 3294)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 1;
elif(player.inArea(3550, 3287, 3557, 3278)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 2;
elif(player.inArea(3561, 3292, 3568, 3285)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 3;
elif(player.inArea(3570, 3302, 3579, 3293)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 4;
elif(player.inArea(3571, 3285, 3582, 3278)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 5;
elif(player.inArea(3562, 3279, 3569, 3273)):
player.teleTimer = 3;
player.newLocation = 6;
else:
player.sendMessage(“You find nothing…”);

This might help you out?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Click In A Certain Place[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

I want to add a method in my ClickItem class.

If you click 952 (spade) in certain co’ordinates, you get an item. But only in certain co’ordinates. How would I add that into my Click Item class?

example:

if(itemId == 952) { c.startAnimation(830); }
How would I add certain co’ordinates to that? And if you do click spade in those co’ordinates it gives an item.

Read full topic
